==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=柒-financial,𠀁-ancient}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
The character {{lang|zh|七}} was originally a picture of a vertical line and a horizontal line bisecting each other, meaning something like, “[[cut]] and [[throw away]] the [[remainder]]”. {{och-l|切}} represents the graphical meaning.

The top-most horizontal stroke is done from left to right. The vertical line and bottom-most horizontal line are done as one stroke, from top-left to bottom-right.

===Etymology===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-ni-s||seven}}.
